title: Life Expectancy in USSR and Russia

content.description:
LIFE EXPECTANCY AT BIRTH IN THE SOVIET UNION AND THE RUSSIAN FEDERATION, 1985â€“2017

Source: The World Bank, 2017.
content.question: Using your knowledge and the data in the chart, which of the following is the most significant limitation?

choices.label: The data are based on normative conclusions derived from census data, so they cannot be interpreted in a meaningful way.
Because the Soviet Union dissolved in 1991, the data are not useful in any analyses of the Soviet Union or Russia over time.
The data do not distinguish between male and female life expectancy, which is an important distinction in Russia.
There are not enough data points to detect a clear trend regarding life expectancy at birth in Russia after 1991.

content.answer: The data do not distinguish between male and female life expectancy, which is an important distinction in Russia.

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Explain possible limitations of the data provided.
